description:
Based on the Emily of New Moon novel by Lucy Maud Montgomery. Emily is an orphan who gets sent to live with her relatives on Prince Edward Island, after her father dies. In New Moon she lives with her Aunt Elizabeth, Aunt Laura, and Cousin Jimmy, and learns to adapt with the help of her imagination and new friends.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

node.description:
__Height:__ 153 cm

Mitsuko Horie is a Japanese seiyuu and singer. She was born in Yamato, Kanagawa, Japan. She is most known to American anime fans as the voice of Sailor Galaxia, but in all Latin-America she is know as the "Candy-Candy" opening theme singer.

[Website](https://akira-miyagawa.com/) | [Blog](https://akira-miyagawa.com/blog-sub/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akiramiyagawa)

Akira Miyagawa is a Japanese composer, arranger, music director and pianist. Born in Tokyo, he is the son of famous composer [Hiroshi Miyagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/110495/Hiroshi-Miyagawa).

He made his debut as a composer on shows at Tokyo Disney Land and Shiki Theatre Company. His motto is "Concerts are entertainments". Performing his concerts in all over Japan, he composed and appeared in many TV shows for NHK. He is also active in other range of fields such as animation, films, and television dramas.

In 2012, he composed and recreated the original score by his father for the remake of [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/12029/Star-Blazers-Space-Battleship-Yamato-2199/), as well as its sequels.

[Website](https://akira-miyagawa.com/) | [Blog](https://akira-miyagawa.com/blog-sub/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akiramiyagawa)

Akira Miyagawa is a Japanese composer, arranger, music director and pianist. Born in Tokyo, he is the son of famous composer [Hiroshi Miyagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/110495/Hiroshi-Miyagawa).

He made his debut as a composer on shows at Tokyo Disney Land and Shiki Theatre Company. His motto is "Concerts are entertainments". Performing his concerts in all over Japan, he composed and appeared in many TV shows for NHK. He is also active in other range of fields such as animation, films, and television dramas.

In 2012, he composed and recreated the original score by his father for the remake of [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/12029/Star-Blazers-Space-Battleship-Yamato-2199/), as well as its sequels.

Shimada graduated from the Department of Education at Waseda University. In 1981, when she was in her third university year, she learned that Toei Douga was recruiting new employees and took an exam to become a trainee director. The studio's policy at the time was not to employ women as directors, and although she scored top marks in the exam, she was encouraged to try writing screenplays instead. She made her debut with a script for episode 42 of Dr. Slump: Arale-chan, which was aired on 10 February 1982. After that, she established a successful career in scriptwriting. On 15 December 2017, she passed away at age 58 from an undisclosed disease.

Shimada graduated from the Department of Education at Waseda University. In 1981, when she was in her third university year, she learned that Toei Douga was recruiting new employees and took an exam to become a trainee director. The studio's policy at the time was not to employ women as directors, and although she scored top marks in the exam, she was encouraged to try writing screenplays instead. She made her debut with a script for episode 42 of Dr. Slump: Arale-chan, which was aired on 10 February 1982. After that, she established a successful career in scriptwriting. On 15 December 2017, she passed away at age 58 from an undisclosed disease.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/奥田誠治_(アニメーション演出家%29)

Seiji Okuda is a veteran anime director. He established Project Team Eikyuukikan, a collaboration of several animators, which was disbanded by him in October 2009. He continues to work freelance, mostly as storyboarder. He is also a member of the JAniCA.

_Note: Not to be confused with the producer [Seiji Okuda](https://anilist.co/staff/219343/)._

Lucy Maud Montgomery OBE called "Maud" by family and friends and publicly known as L. M. Montgomery, was a Canadian author best known for a series of novels beginning with Anne of Green Gables, published in 1908. Anne of Green Gables was an immediate success. The central character, Anne, an orphaned girl, made Montgomery famous in her lifetime and gave her an international following. The first novel was followed by a series of sequels with Anne as the central character. Montgomery went on to publish 20 novels as well as 500 short stories and poems. Because many of the novels were set on Prince Edward Island, Canada and the Canadian province became literary landmarks. She was awarded Officer of the Order of the British Empire in 1935.

Yoshimoto Yumi is a lyricist, novelist and essayist born in Tokyo, Japan. She graduated from Seijo University's English Language Department and debuted in June 1984. Yoshimoto is married and has a daughter.

[Website](https://akira-miyagawa.com/) | [Blog](https://akira-miyagawa.com/blog-sub/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akiramiyagawa)

Akira Miyagawa is a Japanese composer, arranger, music director and pianist. Born in Tokyo, he is the son of famous composer [Hiroshi Miyagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/110495/Hiroshi-Miyagawa).

He made his debut as a composer on shows at Tokyo Disney Land and Shiki Theatre Company. His motto is "Concerts are entertainments". Performing his concerts in all over Japan, he composed and appeared in many TV shows for NHK. He is also active in other range of fields such as animation, films, and television dramas.

In 2012, he composed and recreated the original score by his father for the remake of [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/12029/Star-Blazers-Space-Battleship-Yamato-2199/), as well as its sequels.

Affiliated with [Yumeta Company](https://anilist.co/studio/96/Yumeta-Company).

Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.
